receipt.links: (Equifax Canada at http://www.consumer.equifax.ca/home/en_ca, TransUnion at http://www.transunion.ca/sites/ca/home_en), Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission at http://www.crtc.gc.ca/eng/home-accueil.htm, Canadian Cyber Incident Response Centre at http://www.publicsafety.gc.ca/cnt/ntnl-scrt/cbr-scrt/ccirc-ccric-eng.aspx and Service Canada at http://www.servicecanada.gc.ca/eng/sc/sin/index.shtml.
receipt.name: Name
receipt.nextSteps: Next steps you may take if applicable
receipt.title: Fraud Reporting System Receipt

attention.body: Please be aware that we are not a criminal investigative agency, we are a central repository for fraud data. Our Operational Support Unit provides support to law enforcement agencies by analyzing fraud data submitted. If you are currently being victimized please contact your local police service immediately for assistance. If you're already a victim and wish to have a follow from the police, or require a file number for insurance purposes, you will need to contact your local police service to file a complaint.
attention.title: Attention

feedback.body: We appreciate you taking the time to provide your comments/feedback. We value your input however due to our limited resource capacity we may not be able to respond to every message. Rest assured however that each and every message will be read by management. For comments/suggestions/feedback about the look and feel of the new website please send them to comments@antifraudcentre.ca
feedback.title: Feedback

nextSteps.body1: If you, or someone for who you are filing, was the victim of fraud please contact your local police.
nextSteps.body2: Additionally, there are a number of other agencies that may be able to assist. The following list is provided as a starting point: Financial institution, credit card company, insurance company, telephone company, Provincial Consumer Protection Agency, credit bureaus
nextSteps.title: Next steps you may take if applicable

successPanel.recordAndPrint: Please record the complaint reference number for your records in case you have to contact us in the future. Click here for a printable version of your complaint

submitted.thankYouForSubmitting:
Thank you for taking the time to provide your report. Your information is vital to law enforcement in the fight against fraud. It may provide the missing piece of information that leads to the arrest and conviction of a criminal and/or criminal organization, and help prevent others from becoming a victim.

 The details of your circumstances have been added to a database for information purposes, and will be analyzed for correlation to other fraudulent activity. This may or may not result in a referral to a law enforcement agency having jurisdiction to investigate your allegations.

error.label: The form could not be submitted because 1 error was found.
error.labelPlural: The form could not be submitted because {{errors}} errors were found.

general.datePickerFormatDescription: Four digits year, dash, two digits month, dash, two digits day

steps.info: A complaint has been started with the reference number __{{referenceNumber}}__. Record this number in case you lose your internet connection and need to contact us to complete your complaint over the phone.

steps.previousNext: Once you have clicked on the "Continue" button, please navigate through the application using only the "Previous" and "Next" buttons that appear at the bottom of each screen and not your Internet browser's "Back" and "Forward" buttons.

step1.body: Optionally provide contact details for the victim and filer of this complaint. If you provide an email address you will recieve an automated email receipt upon submission.

filerInformation.relationshipToVictim: What is your relationship with the victim?

general.info: By providing complete and detailed contact information it ensures that Police partner agencies can contact you in the future regarding this complaint.
general.languagePreferred: What is your preferred language of communication?
general.willingToBeContacted: Are you willing to be contacted for a followup?

victimInformation.languagesSpoken: What other languages do you speak?

questions.businessAnonymous: Does the business wish to remain anonymous?
questions.filerAnonymous: As the filer, do you wish to remain anonymous?
questions.victimAnonymous: Does the victim of this fraud wish to remain anonymous?
questions.victimBusiness: Is the victim of this fraud a business?

step1.title: Contact Details

step2.body: Using our Fraud Selection Tool, you will be able to review common fraud types and select the one you were a victim of. Following this, you may enter general details for this complaint such as dollar amount lost, date of occurrence, and a complaint summary.
step2.moneyLost: Was money lost as a result of this fraud?
step2.multipleSelectHint: To select more than one item hold the CTRL key (Command key on Mac) while clicking.
step2.occurrenceDate: Approximately when did this fraud first occur?
step2.paymentMethods: Indicate payment methods involved with this fraud
step2.personalInfoUsedFor: What was obtained with your personal information?
step2.summaryComments:
Please describe in your own words how this crime took place. Enter any extra information that you could not enter anywhere else.

Be specific. Include date(s) of transaction(s), a description of any items that were not delivered or were counterfeited, any transaction numbers (from Ebay, Western Union, PayPal, etc.), and any other pertinent information that helps to explain how you were victimized. Also if you received anything by Mail, FedEx, or UPS, specifically describe the envelope, by the date, time, city and postal code shown on the stamp cancellation postmark.
step2.suspectInfoUsedType: What information was used by the suspect?
step2.suspectVictimContactType: How were you first contacted by the suspect?
step2.totalAmountLostDescription: Please enter the total amount of money actually lost due to this fraud (ex. 123.45)
step2.title: Fraud Type Selection

step3.body: Add details for up to 5 suspects including information such as name, phone numbers, addresses, etc.
step3.info: Provide any information about the individuals/business that victimized you. We support up to 5 separate suspects which may contain up to 2 addresses, 4 phone numbers, 2 email addresses, 1 website and 1 IP address.
step3.title: Suspect Information

step4.body: Upload up to 3 files that are related to this complaint.
step4.info: If you have any files related to this complaint that you believe may be important, you can upload them here. We accept up to 3 files with a maximum file size of 4 MB each. Supported file extensions include .png, .jpg, .jpeg, .doc, .docx, .xls, .xlsx, .pdf and .txt.
step4.title: File Upload

steps.stepsInfo: Filing a complaint is comprised of the following steps:

toastr.failedToGetCode: Failed to get code after two attempts.
